argument.description: The BINARY_FLOAT or BINARY_NUMBER to test for a Nan (Not a number).
The value returned if value is Nan (not a number).

returnType: The NANVL function returns a substitute value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL NANVL function lets you substitute a value for a floating point number such as BINARY_FLOAT or BINARY_DOUBLE, when a Nan (Not a number) value is encountered. This is most commonly used to convert Nan (Not a number) values into either NULL or 0.
